p.s: The following analysis is about the speech Boris Johnson, the britishBritish Premierminister, was holdingheld during the opening ceremony at the COP26 in Glasgow at the 1st November of 2021.
He tells the participants to take action on climate change, because it is the last time they could save the world.
The speech can be parted into six paragraphs.
The first paragraph (ll. 1-9) is the beginning of the speech, Johnson starts into the topic of climate change with a comparison.
He compares a James Bond movie to the actual state of climate change and that the global leaders need to stop the doomsday device like James Bond.
He goes over all the climate conferences that already happened and says this one here in Glasgow is the most important one (ll. 10-15).
Furthemore Johnson points out that the technologies are existing and the moneysmoney to engage the project to get climate-neutral in Europe and all over the world is also there (ll. 16-29).
But the will of the leaders is missing.
Although they might not be alive at the point climate begins to get critical, says Johnson (ll. 30-36).
He makes clear that younger generations not born will judge them when they fail the historic turning point: this conference.
And he goes back to his statement that we all god the things to stop climate change (ll. 37-46).
In the last paragraph he ends his speech by telling the audience that together they can work like James Bond and defuse the climate change (l. 47-51).
